sentence.content: John Major, endorsed by Margaret Thatcher as the politician closest to her heart, was elected by the Conservative Party Tuesday night to succeed her as prime minister.

sentence.content: During his five-day campaign, Major had aaid he would review the ``poll tax,&apost;&apost; an unpopular local tax brought in by Mrs. Thatcher, but he gave no other hints of differing with her.
